DCC.FleetingLuckClearButtonTitle: Take all Mojo from all users
DCC.FleetingLuckClearTitle: Take all Mojo from this user
DCC.FleetingLuckGiveTitle: Award a point of Mojo to this user
DCC.FleetingLuckResetButtonTitle: Reset Mojo for a new session
DCC.FleetingLuckTakeTitle: Take a point of Mojo from this user
DCC.SettingAutomateFleetingLuckHint: Automatically track Mojo based on roll results

MojoDefault: You earn a mojo point for rolling a natural 20 on your action die during combat.
You earn a mojo point for successfully completing an encounter.
XCC.GrandstandingHint: Click to roll a Grandstanding check, CMD/CTRL click for more options
XCC.GrandstandingMessage:
{actorName} works the crowd (DC{crowd}) and rolls a {rollHTML} on their Grandstanding check.
The crowd {result}
XCC.RollFumbleTwoWeapons: Roll Fumble (only if both attacks fumbled)
XCC.GrappleRollEmote:
{actorName} attempts a DC{rollHTML} grapple {deedRollHTML}.

The target must make an attack check. If the roll is below {rollHTML}, the grapple deals {damageRollHTML} damage.

If {actorName} started the round grappling, instead of dealing damage, they can drag the target 5'.

The drag distance increases by 5’ for every 4 points the check failed by.

At DC{rollHTML} extra 5' applies at: {rollResult2}, {rollResult3}, {rollResult4}, etc.{crit}

Settings.IncludeGrappleInWeaponsHint: Include grapple check as a weapon in Athlete's equipment tab for ease of access.
Settings.IncludeUnarmedInWeaponsHint: Include unarmed attacks as weapons in Brawler's equipment tab for ease of access.
Settings.IncludeShieldBashInWeapons: Dwarf's Shield Bash as a Weapon
Settings.IncludeShieldBashInWeaponsHint: Include shield bash as a weapon in Dwarf's equipment tab for ease of access.
Settings.UseSameDeedHalfOrcHint: Use the Deed Die result from the last attack for Half-Orc's Wild Attack (instead of re-rolling the Deed Die).
Settings.RegisterLevelDataPackHint: Automatically register the XCC Class Level Items with the system.
Settings.RegisterCritTablesPackHint: Automatically register the XCC Critical Hit Tables with the system.
Settings.RegisterDisapprovalPackHint: Automatically register the XCC Messenger Disapproval Table with the system.
Settings.AutomateMessengerDisapprovalHint: Automatically apply Disapproval on failed Holy Act checks.
Settings.HideNotesTabHint: Hide notes tab in the actor sheet. This compensates for the additional Xcrawl tab and keeps the sheet width manageable. You can find a smaller replacement notes field in the Xcrawl tab.
Settings.SmallerPauseHint: Enable smaller and less intrusive pause animation.
Settings.IsDebugHint: Prints out debug information about objects and events into the browser console. Intended for module developers.

Athlete.RollAgilityCheckHint: Click to roll an Agility check, CMD/CTRL click for more options, SHIFT click to add the training die
Athlete.RollStrengthCheckHint: Click to roll a Strength check, CMD/CTRL click for more options, SHIFT click to add the training die
Athlete.RollStaminaCheckHint: Click to roll a Stamina check, CMD/CTRL click for more options, SHIFT click to add the training die
Athlete.ArmorWarning: Armor too heavy - grapple crits disabled.
WeaponTraining: You are trained with spear, club, dagger, quarterstaff, javelin, and sports equipment.
Benefits: You can add your Training Die to athletics skill checks (SHIFT-click ability label),
Fast Movement increases your climbing and swimming movement rates by 50%,
Large creatures get only half of their size bonus against your grapples.
Restrictions: Armor check penalty of -4 negates Scramble, Fast Movement, and Grapple Criticals,
You cannot grapple while holding a shield.
You must choose the Wrestling Technique BEFORE making the grapple check,
Athletic Durability only negates subdual damage.
Mojo: You earn a Mojo point for any creature defeated with nothing but grapple damage.

WeaponTraining: You are trained with longsword, short sword, spear, club, dagger, and crossbow.
Benefits: You automatically pick Spellweaver Blast as your first known spell.
Restrictions: You cannot scribe scrolls (but you can still use them).
You can never summon permanent familiars nor create permanent magic items (even when using scrolls).
Your second action die can only be used for spell checks.
Mojo: You earn a Mojo point for participating in defeating a magic user.

WeaponTraining: You are trained in unarmed fighting, all melee weapons, bows (any) and crossbows.
Benefits: When armed, and attacking in melee, you get a free unarmed attack [d14],
When unarmed, you make two unarmed attacks [d16] instead of one,
When unarmed, you crit on roll results of 16 and fumble on double 1s.
Restrictions: Toughness reduces only melee damage,
The free attack can be used only once per round, even with multiple action dice.
Mojo: You earn a Mojo point for every creature defeated using only unarmed attacks, as long as their HD is equal to, or greater, than your level.

Jammer.LionizeEmote: {actorName} lionizes their ally with a {rollHTML} performance check!
Jammer.DisrespectMessage:
{actorName} disrespects their opponent with a {rollHTML} performance check!

Target must make a DC {rollResult} Willpower save or be disrespected for {duration} rounds.

Disrespected target suffers a {disrespectPenalty} penalty to their attack rolls, spell checks, damage rolls, and Willpower saves.
WeaponTraining: You are trained with the longsword, short sword, rapier, hand axe, dagger, spear, and crossbow.
Benefits: You are trained in one performance specialty and can pick up one more for every level you earn.
Restrictions: Being unable to move or having an armor check penalty of -4 negates your chosen weapon AC bonus,
Disrespect is ineffective against inanimate objects, slimes, and constructed creatures, such as golems.
Mojo: Unlike other classes, you can spend mojo AFTER your ally makes the die roll.
You earn a Mojo point whenever a disrespected enemy fails an attack/spell check.

Messenger.LayOnHandsNotes: Free d14 melee attack modified by luck
Messenger.TurnUnholyNotes: Declare main target before the roll
Messenger.TurnUnholyFlavor: turns unholy with a result of
Messenger.SummonWeaponFlavor: summons deity's favored weapon with a result of
Messenger.BlessNotes: Touch. Doesn't affect Holy Act checks
Messenger.BlessFlavor: blesses the target with a result of
Messenger.UnholyLawful: Chaotic warriors, undead, demons, devils, chaotic dragons/messengers.
Messenger.UnholyNeutral: Dire animals, elementals, undead, demons, devils, lycanthropes, slimes.
Messenger.UnholyChaotic: Undead, lawful extraplanar beings, lawful warriors, lawful dragons/messengers.
Messenger.NoAlignment: Choose an alignment to display unholy creatures.
Messenger.LayOnHandsFlavor: lays on hands with a result of
Messenger.LayOnHandsAlternate:
If declared before the roll, HD can heal a condition instead of hit points:
  • 1HD - Broken limbs
  • 2HD - Disease, organ damage
  • 3HD - Paralysis, poison
  • 4HD - Blindness/Deafness
Messenger.DisapprovalFlavor: {actor} fails the Holy Act check with a natural roll of {roll} and incurs the disapproval of their deity!
Messenger.DivineAidFlavor:
{actor} calls upon their deity for aid!
The deity grants requests of DC{roll} and lower.

Example effects:
Messenger.DeityRequest: If the request is granted, the deity will request a specific act in return.
WeaponTraining: You are trained with deity's favored weapon, dagger, club, staff, and sling.
Benefits: Your blood can act as a holy symbol for the encounter (cut yourself for 1 damage).
Restrictions: Scourge damage applies only to unholy creatures attacked with a favored weapon.
Mojo: You earn a Mojo point for healing a downed (0hp) ally.
You earn a Mojo point for each successful Turn Unholy.

WeaponTraining: You are trained in long sword, short sword, longbow, shortbow, and dagger.
Benefits: You roll +1d for saving throws against magical sleep and paralysis effects
You automatically pick Cantrip as your first known spell.
You roll and add your Charisma Die to all Grandstanding checks and to Personality checks like negotiation, deception, etc.
You can spend your move action to make an Acrobatics check. You can still move half your movement rate (full at lvl 5+) as a part of this check.
Acrobatics check lets you DODGE incoming attacks, WITHDRAW from combat without provoking attacks, and MITIGATE fall damage (free check).
Restrictions: -1 to hit when using cold-iron weapons, and -1 AC when wearing cold-iron armor.
When you choose a new spell make a Luck check. On success you get the spell, on failure you get a random spell of the same level.
Mojo: You earn a Mojo point for every point of Fame you earn.

WeaponTraining: You are trained with battleaxe, hand axe, longsword, mace, short sword, spear, two-handed sword, warhammer, crossbow, javelin, shortbow, and sling.
Benefits: You can see in the dark up to 60'.
Armor does not reduce your base movement speed.
You can smell gold/gems within 100’ (single coin/gem within 40' when focused).
You add your initial Luck modifier to all attack rolls made with your lucky weapon.
When underground, you add your character level to checks to detect traps, slanting passages, shifting walls, and new construction.
Restrictions: You receive only one Shield Bash and one Mighty Deed attempt each round.
You have a base movement speed of 20’.
Mojo: You earn a Mojo point for the defeat of every ogre, giant, or troll you participate in.

Gnome.DrawAgroMessage:
{actorName} attempts to draw agro with a {rollHTML} check!

The target must make a DC {rollResult} Willpower save or spend their next action attacking {actorName}.

The target may choose to resist this effect, but in doing so they take a {penalty} penalty to all combat actions on their turn.
Gnome.TeamMascotDieMessage: {actorName} rolls their Mascot Die and gains {rollHTML} Mojo points!
WeaponTraining: You are trained in short sword, dagger, crossbow, shortbow and quarterstaff.
Benefits: You are small. You are 3½ to 4½ feet (100-140cm) tall, and weigh between 40 and 90 pounds (20-40kg).
Restrictions: You have a base movement speed of 25’.
Draw Agro works only on sentient targets that can see and hear you.
Mojo: Result of natural 20 on an attack roll or a spell checks earns you a number of Mojo Points determined by the roll of your Team Mascot Die.
You earn a Mojo point after the whole team loses Mojo due to a roll of natural 1.
You earn a Mojo point each time your Draw Agro causes an enemy to target you.

WeaponTraining: You are trained in the use of axes (all), bows (all), crossbows, daggers, javelins, lances, polearms, spears, swords (all), and warhammers.
Benefits: You can see in the dark up to 60'.
You make saving throws against disease and poison effects at +1d.
You heal 2 hit points and 2 physical ability points per night of rest (3 per full day).
+1d on Personality skill checks to frighten, bully, or intimidate.
Deed Die result treated as 1 higher for calculating effects of intimidation Deeds.
You make a Wild Attack if you provoked a free attack after your regular strike.
Restrictions: You can Wild Attack only once per round and only with a melee weapon in melee.
Opponents unable to attack in melee may never be targeted by a wild attack.
Opponents targeted by a wild attack must use the same attack as their last.
Intelligent opponents may forgo their free attack to avoid the wild attack.
You get -1d on Personality checks vs. mistrusting citizens. Negated at 3rd level.
You begin the game as a non-citizen of the NAE.
Mojo: You earn a Mojo point for every solo kill (all damage must come from you).

Acrobat.AcrobaticsMessage:
Dodge: {reflex} AC against {enemies}

Withdraw: {withdraw}

Mitigate: Reduce fall damage by {fall}.
Acrobat.PoleVaultMessage:
Max barrier height: {height}’ (DC {dc}).

Doesn't prevent potential falling damage (must roll to mitigate).
Acrobat.TightRopeMessage:
Success: They cross the gap safely (10' per full round by default). Reroll the check only if conditions change (moving faster, strong wind, being hit, etc).

Failure by 1-5: They need to make a Reflex save against the same DC.
  • Success: They drop held items and hold onto the rope.
  • Failure: They fall.

Failure by 5+: They fall.

Fumble: They fall and may not mitigate falling damage.
Acrobat.TightRopeFootnotes:
DC modifiers:
moderate wind+5
strong wind+10
20' balance pole-5
40' balance pole-8
being hitDC 10+dmg
Roll a new check on sudden changes.
Acrobat.WithdrawMultiple: Withdraw from combat with multiple opponents without provoking any attacks.
Acrobat.WithdrawSingle: Withdraw from combat with a single opponent without provoking any attacks.
Acrobat.DodgeSingle: a single ranged attack until next action.
Acrobat.DodgeMultiple: multiple ranged attacks, or a single opponent in melee, until next action.
WeaponTraining: You are trained in  crossbow, dagger, dart, short sword, sling, and staff.
Benefits: You can spend your move action to make an Acrobatics check. You can still move half your movement rate (full at lvl 5+) as a part of this check.
Acrobatics check lets you DODGE incoming attacks, WITHDRAW from combat without provoking attacks, and MITIGATE fall damage (free check).
Pole Vault check lets you jump over barriers as tall as your pole (up to 25’).
You can make a Tightrope walk check to move across narrow beams (DC 10), thick ropes (DC 15), and thin ropes (DC 20).
You add your Leap bonus to jump checks (including running jump, and high jump).
Restrictions: Tightrope walk DC mods: moderate wind (DC+5), strong wind (DC+10), 2/3 speed (DC+5), full speed (DC+10), double speed (DC+20), 20' balance pole (DC-5), 40' balance pole (DC-8), being hit (DC becomes 10+dmg).
Mojo: You earn a Mojo point for slaying an opponent you strike after a successful acrobatics check on the same round.

WeaponTraining: You are trained in blackjack, blowgun, crossbow, dagger, dart, garrote, hand axe, longsword, short sword, and sling.
Benefits: You can backstab with a sling or hurled dagger at targets up to medium range, or an alchemist charge at short range.
If you spend Luck on damage, your Luck die increases by +1d on the chain.
Mojo: You earn a Mojo point for every opponent you put down with a backstab.

WeaponTraining: You are trained in short swords, daggers, slings, shortbows, hand crossbows, pistols and revolvers.
Benefits: You can make Criminal Connections check to seek help from your associates in the area (home turf DC 5, major city DC 10, small city DC 15, small town DC 20).

You can make a Disguise Self check to: DC 5 - resemble someone of the same species and dimensions. DC 10 - change significant facial features. DC 15 - Change mannerisms, height, etc. DC 20 - Fool someone close to the target.

Bribery Expert check lets you know if target would be receptive to a bribe, and how much it would take to bribe them for a given task. Home turf DC 10, Location with criminal connections DC 15, completely strange locale DC 20.
Restrictions: Criminal Connections can’t normally be used in the wilderness, at sea, etc.
Forging official documents requires 100 gp worth of equipment and costs 100-600 gp in bribes per year to keep stamps, seals, and licensing information current.
Mojo: You earn a Mojo point for Xcrawl rule breaking. The transgression must be helpful, and not get you into trouble. Particularly sweet score should increase the Mojo bonus up to 1d6 points.

WeaponTraining: You are trained in short swords, daggers, slings, shortbows, hand crossbows.
Benefits: You can make a Danger Sense check to detect concealed enemies and their approximate location in 60' range. DC 10 for simple concealment, DC 15 for camouflaged or careful concealment, and a DC 20 against invisible creatures.
Shortbow backstab damage increases to 1d8 and Sling backstab damage to 1d6.
Restrictions: Danger Sense works against creatures, not traps (even if they hold creatures).
Danger Sense doesn't tell you precisely what the threat is.
You may only backstab with a shortbow or sling at short range.
Mojo: You earn a Mojo point for successfully spotting an ambush, or for finding and disarming a trap.

CryptRaider.DisapprovalFlavor: {actor} fails the Turn Unholy check and must spend {roll} hours in prayer and meditation before attempting to Turn Unholy again!
WeaponTraining: You are trained in short swords, daggers, slings, shortbows, hand crossbows.
Benefits: You learn spoken and written Latin.
You increase your Luck Die by +2d when you spend luck to turn, attack, damage or save against un-dead or demons.
You can backstab with holy water hurled as a ranged attack within 10’.
Restrictions: You roll -1d on all Grandstanding checks.
Mojo: You earn a Mojo point for each successful Turn Unholy.
You earn a Mojo point for every un-dead creature or demon you directly participate in destroying.

WeaponTraining: You are trained in hand axes, short swords, daggers, slings, shortbows, hand crossbows.
Benefits: You can see in the dark up to 60'.
You always know your approximate depth underground.
You speak a secret Dwarf Mechanic cant - The Shale.
You get +1d to Find and Disable Trap checks that involve pits, moving stonework, sliding walls, and structural deadfalls.
When underground, you add your character level to checks to detect sloping passageways, secret doors involving shifting walls, and new construction.
Restrictions: You get -2d to social checks vs. dwarves. Becomes -1d at 3rd level, negated at 4th.
You never receive sponsorship from dwarven companies or nobility.
Mojo: You earn two Mojo points when you disarm a trap on the first attempt and then grill its maker on the camera. Extra Mojo for particularly witty or cutting comments.
You earn a Mojo point for every giant, troll, or ogre you help your team destroy.

WeaponTraining: You are trained in short swords, daggers, staff, and shortbows.
Benefits: You can see in the dark up to 60'.
You are immune to magical sleep and paralysis.
You automatically pick Cantrip as your first known spell.
Your Cantrip effect lasts for up to 10 rounds, and you can always choose a lesser effect if it better suits your purposes.
On a Cantrip spell check of 18 or better the kinetic effect, allows you to pick locks, disarm traps, pick pockets, or affect other complicated operations at range.
Restrictions: Direct contact of iron with your skin does 1 point of damage per day of exposure.
You cannot spellburn nor accept corruption for a bonus to your spell check.
Mojo: You earn 1–3 Mojo points for battlefield tricks that dupe, delay, divide, or neutralize opponents. The more elaborate and helpful the trick, the more Mojo you earn.

WeaponTraining: You are trained in the use of the battleaxe, club, crossbow, dagger, dart, flail, hand axe, javelin, longsword, shortbow, sling, spear, and two-handed sword.
Benefits: You can see in the dark up to 30'.
You make saving throws against disease and poison effects at +1d.
You heal two hit points and two physical ability points per night of rest (three with a full day of care and bed rest).
If you spend Luck on damage, your Luck die increases by +1d on the chain.
You can always backstab prone targets.
Restrictions: You take a -1d penalty on Personality checks other than intimidation and Grandstanding.
You begin the game as a non-citizen of the NAE.
Mojo: You earn a Mojo point for every creature you single-handedly kill.

WeaponTraining: You are trained in short swords, daggers, slings, shortbows, hand crossbows.
Benefits: You can see in the dark up to 30'.
You can backstab with slings, daggers, and hurled stones from up to short range.
Your backstab damage is increased: dagger (1d10), hurled stone (1d5), sling (1d8).
Restrictions: In public, you are treated as an outcast in halfling society. Privately, you are considered a heroic adventurer.
Mojo: You earn a Mojo point for downing an opponent with a backstab
You earn a Mojo point for every successfully disarmed trap.

Rewards.FameTip: Fame is a measure of your renown and reputation. It is earned by completing adventures, achieving goals, and performing notable deeds. Fame can open doors to new opportunities, but it can also attract unwanted attention.
Rewards.FameCheckFailure: Unrecognized: Target does not recognize you from XCrawl at all.
Rewards.FameCheckSmallSuccess: Known only by sight: Target recognizes your face from XCrawl.
Rewards.FameCheckNormalSuccess: Known: Target knows your face, name and class from XCrawl
Rewards.FameCheckBigSuccess: Well Known: Target knows your name, class, career highlights, major victories, teams you played with, gossip, etc.
Rewards.WealthCheckFailure: Beyond Reach: You can't afford this major expense.
Rewards.WealthCheckSmallSuccess: Outrageous: You would have to spend all your wealth to afford this major expense.
Rewards.WealthCheckNormalSuccess: Pricey: You would have to spend [[/roll 2d5]] wealth to afford this major expense.
Rewards.WealthCheckBigSuccess: Affordable: You would only have to spend 1 wealth to afford this major expense.
Rewards.WealthTip: Wealth is calculated by adding up all sponsorship offers. Hover the label to the left of this icon to learn more about the current wealth rank.

21-50.Title: Middle Class
21-50.Meaning: [21-50] On solid ground, but must save for big purchases.

51-70.Title: Making It
51-70.Meaning: [51-70] Comfortable, secure, can occasionally go big.

71-90.Title: Wealthy
71-90.Meaning: [71-90] You are doing extremely well, have some investments, etc.

91-95.Title: Rich
91-95.Meaning: [91-95] You live a rare life of privilege.

96-99.Title: Fabulously Wealthy
96-99.Meaning: [96-99] Few luxuries are out of your reach.

100+.Title: Obscenely Rich
100+.Meaning: [100+] Nothing is out of your reach.
